title: Kitchen Tips From the Chef Drew Barrymore Calls ‘My Culinary Partner in Crime’
sub_head: With the new cookbook, ‘Rebel Homemaker,’ actress Drew Barrymore and her co-author and private chef Pilar Valdes lay out their accessible, appealing style of collaborating in the kitchen. Ms. Valdes invited us into her Brooklyn kitchen to share insider advice.
body: Three years ago, actress Drew Barrymore found herself at a crossroads. Newly divorced, at the end of her Netflix series “Santa Clarita Diet,” she was a Californian newly transplanted to New York, trying to get her daughter into kindergarten. As it happened, chef Pilar Valdes was at a similar transition point. After working in nonprofits for almost a decade, she had started Kickshaw Cookery, initially a membership lunch-delivery service, with a friend. When her business partner moved out of state, Ms. Valdes started thinking about the future of Kickshaw—by then also a catering company—and began working with Ms. Barrymore, first as a chef and later as a regular guest on CBS’s “The Drew Barrymore Show.”
